page.title: 01Knarsdale Common
page.content: Knarsdale Common rises to south and west towards highest peaks of the North Pennines. Knar Burn cuts a deep valley North to South through the centre of the common. Towards the south east Thornhope Fell rises to 540m. The extreme east of the block comprises the western slopes of the South Tyne valley. The north east and central northern parts of the block contain meadow land and hayfields with scattered farms. Outside the valleys, vegetation consists of rough grass, heather and bracken with rushes and cottongrass in the wetlands. The population of the block is approximately 20, all farm families. The uplands are extensively grazed by sheep. The only trees are in the cloughs and valley bottoms.
